message:
SYSTEM: ODPs-v6.pdf: Página 18
21

Covering is related to the requirements that are to be solved by a model, or a pattern. A pattern 
covers a set of requirements, if it is expressive enough to store the necessary knowledge to 
answer the full set of competency questions (CQs) representing the requirements. 

Cloning involves making a duplicate of an ontology element, in some cases including all axioms 
defining the element or in some cases only making a partial clone.

Composition is the way of combining two or more patterns, where the result in case of content 
patterns is the union of the axioms of all the patterns together with any additional axioms used to 
link the elements of the different patterns.

Specialization and generalization are relations among patterns, as well as among elements. 
Specialization is also a way of reusing a content pattern, when the elements are specialized and 
thereby form a new ontology tailored to some specific requirements.

Expansion is when a pattern is extended with additional elements or axioms.

Importing is a basic operator for content pattern reuse (since already available in OWL) and is 
the standard way of reusing such OPs.
Content Pattern Reuse: Basic Operations
speaker: SYSTEM
